member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.itemCooldownMax
member.summary: When a new cooldown is applied, this gets set to the duration of the cooldown. Does not tick down unlike

member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.itemCooldown
member.summary: When above 0, the cooldown is active. Ticks down by 1 every player update.

member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.itemCombo
member.summary:
When above 0, you are in a combo. Ticks down by 1 every player update.
Item "combos" are used for determining what type of item action to use.
A usage example would be a weapon with a 3 swing pattern. Each swing will increase the combo meter by 60, and when it becomes greater than 120, reset to 0.

member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.itemUsage
member.summary: Increments when the player uses an item. Does not increment when the player is using the alt function of an item.

member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.itemSwitch
member.summary: A short lived timer which gets set to 30 when the player has a different selected item.

member.name: F:Aequus.AequusPlayer.interactionCooldown
member.summary: Used to prevent players from spam interacting with special objects which may have important networking actions which need to be awaited. Ticks down by 1 every player update.

member.name: M:Aequus.AequusPlayer.SetCooldown(System.Int32,System.Boolean,Terraria.Item)
member.summary:
Sets a cooldown for the player. If the cooldown value provided is less than the player's currently active cooldown, this does nothing.
Use in combination with
member.param: The amount of time the cooldown lasts in game ticks.
Whether or not to ignore cooldown stats and effects. Setting this to true will prevent them from effecting this cooldown

member.name: M:Aequus.AequusWorld.OreTiers

member.name: M:Aequus.AequusWorld.DownedCalls.HandleModCall(Aequus.Aequus,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Obtains or sets a world flag, a list of world flags are provided in ' summary.
Obtaining a flag: aequus.Call("Downed", "Crabson" -- {Or any of the flag names provided})
Setting a flag: aequus.Call("Downed", "Set", "Crabson" -- {Or any of the flag names provided}, {true/false})

member.name: M:Aequus.Content.Necromancy.NecromancyDatabase.HandleModCall(Aequus.Aequus,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Adds a NecroStats data for an npc index in
Parameter 1: NPC Type (short)
Parameter 2: Tier (float), is tier 1, is tier 4
Parameter 3 (Optional): View range (float), how close a slave needs to be to an enemy in order for it to target it. Defaults to 800
Parameter 4+ (Optional): Two paired arguments. One string and one value
A successful mod call would look like: aequus.Call("NecroStats", ModContent.NPCType{...}(), 1f); OR aequus.Call("NecroStats", ModContent.NPCType{...}(), 1f, 800f); OR aequus.Call("NecroStats", ModContent.NPCType{...}(), 1f, 800f, "PrioritizePlayerMultiplier", 4f);
Please handle these mod calls in . As buff immunities are setup in
member.returns: 'Success' when correctly handled. 'Failure' when improperly handled

member.name: M:Aequus.Content.ShopQuotes.QuoteDatabase.AddNPC(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an NPC entry if one doesn't exist already

member.name: M:Aequus.Content.ShopQuotes.QuoteDatabase.HandleModCall(Aequus.Aequus,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Adds shop quote data for an npc
Parameter 1: NPC Type ()
Parameter 2: Key ()
Parameter 2 (Alternative): Mod () Would generate a key which looks like: Mods.MYMODNAME.Chat.(NPCKEY).ShopQuotes.(ITEMKEY)
Parameter 3: Item Type () OR ([])
To make a town npc use a specific quote color:
Parameter 1: NPC Type ()
Parameter 2: Color ()
A successful mod call would look like: aequus.Call("AddShopQuote", , ); OR aequus.Call("AddShopQuote", , this, ); OR aequus.Call("AddShopQuote", , "This is text. I can also use language keys here.", ); aequus.Call("AddShopQuote", , "This is text. I can also use language keys here.", new int[] { , });
Please handle these mod calls in .

member.summary: How long the camera holds in its target position after the caller stops running

member.name: F:Aequus.Graphics.GameCamera.returning
member.summary: Whether or not the camera is returning

member.name: M:Aequus.Graphics.GameCamera.SetTarget(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Aequus.Graphics.CameraPriority,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the camera target to a position, may return false if your priority is below a current target's priority
member.param: Context key, only really useful for 3rd party mods
A world coordinate to point the camera at
The priority of this camera target. If there is a current camera target, and its priority is above, it will prevent you from setting a target and this method will return false
The speed of the camera, the exact time it will get there is: speed / 50So 6 speed means it will get into position in 8 frames. Clamped between 6 and 25
How long the camera holds in its target position after the caller stops running
member.returns: Whether or not the camera target has been set to a new position. Spamming SetTarget will only return true on the first SetTarget call, and the rest will return false
